title: [Large-Scale] ICE Collaborative Learning Workshop for Strengthening Academic Library Information Literacy: Supporting Social Science Research and Enhancing Civic Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic library utilization experience and foundational understanding of social science research methodologies (historical analysis, geographic information systems, economic statistics, etc.). Preliminary knowledge of social institutions and civic rights concepts. Experience designing research considering diverse cultural backgrounds
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education for in-service professionals to enhance academic information search and utilization skills, focusing on social science research (history, geography, economics, politics, culture). Particularly develops information interpretation skills for promoting civic rights and community development, including negotiation strategies for resolving political conflicts. Includes information analysis training considering cultural diversity and political contexts, emphasizing data interpretation techniques for economic equity.

learning_goals: Learners can explain methodologies for efficiently searching academic library databases and electronic resources to extract information relevant to social science research topics (history, geography, economics, etc.). They particularly apply information search strategies considering cultural and political contexts and analyze relationships between various social systems.

Learners apply techniques to evaluate and critically analyze academic information relevant to research topics, performing contextual interpretation considering historical and geographical factors. Through this, they derive evidence-based conclusions for civic rights and community development and develop policy proposals to address economic inequality.

Using the ICE framework, learners collaboratively develop information utilization strategies with peers, establish interdisciplinary research collaboration systems and citizen-participatory research networks, seek practical solutions through political and economic system analysis, and explore inclusive policy designs reflecting cultural diversity.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
